pr_title: DB-9108 allow subquery in the ON clause of flattened inner join node …

timeline.message: DB-9108 allow subquery in the ON clause of flattened inner join node to be flattened

timeline.bodyText:
That's a good use case for hamcrest: more concise, more readable and out of the box comprehensive error message:
assertThat(e.getMessage(), anyOf(containsString(strA), containsString(strB))
or, if you're adventurous:
assertThat(e.getMessage(), matchesPattern("IOException '/noPermissionToCreateFolderInRoot(: Read-only file system)+' when accessing directory"))
The second one might need adjustments, I'm a bit rusty on patterns.
timeline.author: arnaud-splice
arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: Does delayPreproessingJoinClause always return false for HalfOuterJoinNode?
timeline.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: Yes, currently we don't have the logic to flatten ON clause subquery for outer joins (both Half and FullOuterJoinNode), so there is no need to delayPreprocessingJoinClause for Half and FullOuterJoinNode.
replies.author: yxia92

replies.bodyText: If it is always false, this block will never executed.
replies.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: Hi @jyuanca You are correct, this block is not exercised now. I put it here in anticipation that in the future we may support the flattening of ON clause subquery for outer joins too.
replies.author: yxia92
